DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test efficacy uniquely target HIV risk reduction intervention young transgender woman ( YTW ) , age 16 29 , risk HIV acquisition transmission .
DOC.brief_title: HIV Prevention Intervention Young Transgender Women
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study test efficacy uniquely target HIV risk reduction intervention young transgender woman ( YTW ) , age 16 29 , risk HIV acquisition transmission . The study test intervention three-arm randomize control trial two major U.S. city excellent access research experience population ( Chicago , Boston ) . We enroll risk YTW , age 16-29 ; two-fifths sample randomize intervention participate 6-session group-based manualized Life Skills intervention ; two-fifths randomize standard-of-care ( SOC ) control condition ; one-fifth randomize time-matched attention control condition receive standard health promotion information group-based multi-session format . All three arm receive HIV sexually transmit infection ( STI ) ( Chlamydia gonorrhea ) test pre-posttest risk reduction counseling ( i.e. , SOC ) . Sexual risk assess baseline , 4 , 8 12 month post-intervention Our specific aim : 1 ) determine efficacy Life Skills intervention comparison SOC arm time-matched attention control primary outcome : number unprotected anal sex act ( UAS ) ( previous four month ) among YTW , age 16-29 ; 2 ) examine degree improvement sexual risk take mediate conceptual mediator intervention : transgender adaptation integration , collective self-esteem/empowerment , information ( HIV knowledge ) , motivation ( attitude , norm , intention safer sex ) , behavioral skill ( discuss sex condom use sexual partner , acquire use condom ) ; explore whether reduction sexual risk associate epidemiologically-linked moderator sexual risk behavior : age , race/ethnicity , psychosocial factor . An additional exploratory aim describe prevalence HIV STIs community recruit sample ; SOC arm , assess natural trajectory sexual risk behavior acquisition HIV STIs ( incidence rate ) YTW 12-month follow-up period .
DOC.criteria: age 1629 selfidentified transgender , transsexual , and/or female male biological birth sex selfreported history unprotected anal vaginal intercourse , anal vaginal sex one sexual partner , anal vaginal sex exchange money , food , shelter , diagnosis HIV another STI previous 4 month able speak understand English willing able provide inform consent/assent intention reside local area throughout 12 month followup period unable provide inform consent due severe mental physical illness , substance intoxication time interview active suicidal ideation time baseline interview
